channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: M25: Three dead and two arrested after lorry, minibus and car crash
item.description: A fourth person is in hospital after the crash involving a lorry, minibus and car near Waltham Abbey.

item.title: Record number of migrants cross Channel in a day
item.description: More than 800 people reached the UK on Saturday in 30 small boats, the Home Office confirms.

item.title: Boardmasters: 4,700 Covid cases 'may be linked' to Newquay festival
item.description: The full scale of infections linked to Boardmasters in Newquay will not be known for a "few days".

item.title: David Beater: Sex abuse vicar 'protected' by church for decades
item.description: David Beater worked in churches for 25 years despite a conviction for sexually assaulting a child.

item.title: Man arrested as Katie Price taken to hospital
item.description: Police are called to reports of an assault in the early hours of Monday morning.

item.title: Shot in the head in Angola, left for dead, now a Wetherspoons star
item.description: Cesar Kimbirima fled Angola after being shot four times and spending five months in a coma.

item.title: Mission: Impossible request leads to Hollywood encounter
item.description: A request for an unnamed VIP to land in a garden leads to an encounter with Hollywood royalty.

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca should be studied not killed, vets say
item.description: Thirteen vets sign a letter calling on the government to allow Geronimo to live to aid research.

item.title: Alta Fixsler should be allowed home for last moments of life, parents say
item.description: Alta Fixsler, who has been at the centre of a legal row, should be allowed to die at home, her father says.

item.title: Amrou Greenidge: Drug dealers who killed athlete jailed
item.description: Amrou Greenidge died after he was crashed into by a car and then beaten as he lay on the ground.

item.title: Norwich man flies paramotor down UK for Alzheimer's research
item.description: Daniel Jones lands in Cornwall to complete an Alzheimer's challenge in tribute to his grandparents.

item.title: How the world's oldest hat shop made it through lockdown
item.description: Lock & Co was first established in 1676 and has sold hats to the likes of Nelson and Winston Churchill.

item.title: Mission: Impossible train crashes into quarry in Stoney Middleton
item.description: Local photographers said the film's star Tom Cruise had been at the quarry to witness the crash.

item.title: Solihull friends' lockdown boredom turns horse box into pizzeria
item.description: Enterprising teenagers oversee the conversion to launch a mobile food business.

item.title: Ferrybridge chimney stacks demolished in controlled explosion
item.description: The controlled explosion takes place at a former coal-fired power station in West Yorkshire.

item.title: 'Race should not be a factor in my destiny'
item.description: A young Londoner beats 23,000 other entrants in one of the country's largest anti-racism competitions.

item.title: Mark Wood: England bowler out of third Test with shoulder injury
item.description: England bowler Mark Wood is out of the third Test against India because of a shoulder injury.

item.title: T20 Blast quarter-finals: Eight teams battle for Finals Day spot
item.description: The English cricket season moves on from The Hundred to this week's four T20 Blast quarter-finals.

item.title: Premier League confirms 16 new positive Covid cases in latest round of testing
item.description: The Premier League says 16 players and club staff have tested positive for coronavirus over the past week.

item.title: Joe Root says it is 'difficult' to see Azeem Rafiq 'hurting'
item.description: Joe Root says it is "difficult" to see Azeem Rafiq "hurting" after he was the victim of "inappropriate behaviour" at Yorkshire.
